Field Mnemonic: TXE: PAPR Outbound Injection Error Triggered
Description: The condition set up by the PAPR Error Injection Registers triggered its intended condition to inject an outbound error. This is more of a status than an error, but it can be treated like a normal error.

Field Mnemonic: RSB: PCIe Register Access Size/Align Error
Description: A Register access to PCIe space had size or address alignment error.

Field Mnemonic: ARB: IODA MSI PE Mismatch Error
Description: A mismatch error occurred between the MIST and RTT tables.

Field Mnemonic: ARB: MSI Size / Address Align- ment Error
Description: An MSI interrupt was received and was not 16 byte address aligned, or the size field was larger than one data beat (16 byte).
TCE Validation Table error occurred. The entry is invalid, or the PCI Address was out of range as defined by the TTA bounds in the TVE entry.

Field Mnemonic: ARB: PCIe Fatal Error Message Received
Description: The PHB4 received a ERR_FATAL message from an endpoint.

Field Mnemonic: ARB: PCIe Nonfatal Error Mes- sage Received
Description: The PHB4 received an ERR_NONFATAL message from an endpoint.

Field Mnemonic: ARB: PCIe Correctable Error Message Received
Description: The PHB4 received an ERR_CORR message from an endpoint.

Field Mnemonic: ARB: PAPR Inbound Injection Error Triggered
Description: The condition set up by the PAPR Error Injection Registers triggered its intended condition to inject an inbound error. This is more of a status than an error, but it can be treated like a normal error.
A fatal inbound logic or array error occurred. See ARB Error Status register bits for details.
An access was made to a resource and the resource BAR register is not properly set up. In ARB this is the PELTV, RTT.

Field Mnemonic: ARB: Inbound Completion Sta- tus not zeros
Description: A completion TLP had completion status not equal zeros. This status is Unsupported Request (UR) or Com- pletor Abort (CA). In the case of a CFG access, it could include retry status (CRS).
A PCI completion timeout occurred for an outstand- ing PCIe transaction, or an unexpected PCI com- pletion was received and did not match any outstanding PCI requests.
A single bit, correctable error occurred in one of the arrays in the inbound logic.

Field Mnemonic: ARB: Inbound ECC Uncorrect- able Error
Description: A double-bit, uncorrectable error occurred in one of the arrays in the inbound logic.

Field Mnemonic: ARB: Inbound TLP Data Poi- soned Error OR ARB: Secure Address Error (vA4.2)
Description: A TLP was received and its TLP header indicates that the data was poisoned. Secure Address Error (vA4.2) Non-translated DMA address matched against secure address checker. Refer to UV - Secure Address Exclude CMP/MSK Register on page 295.
The PE number in the RTE was all ones (all 16 bits). This indicates that it is an invalid entry.
A fatal inbound logic or array error occurred. See MRG Error Status register bits for details.
An access was made to a resource and the resource BAR register is not properly set up. In MRG this is the PEST.
A single bit, correctable error occurred in one of the arrays in the inbound logic.
A double-bit, uncorrectable error occurred in one of the arrays in the inbound logic.
An inbound transaction, request or response, could not be sent on the AIB TX interface before a set timeout period.
A Migration Register Table error occurred.

This error checks that the interrupt notification address is within the secure range when the secure check is enabled. If the address is not in the secure range it will flag this error. Refer to the interrupt notification registers starting on page 110 and the secure control registers start- ing on page 297.

PB logic above the PHB4 asserted its raise fence signal. This error is also routed to the LEM FIR. This can be used for debug in conjunction with the LEM WOF to test if the PB logic asserted its fence before other PHB4 errors. The PHB4 logic detects the error as a rising edge of the PB signal. The error will not reassert if the PB signal remains constant.

Field Mnemonic: LEM FIR Internal Parity Error PCI Clock Domain SCOM Error
Description: Parity error on the LEM FIR has occurred. This sig- nal is from inside the local FIR macro logic. The SCOM error is asserted from a source signal external to the PHB4. It indicates there was an SCOM state machine error during a register opera- tion.
